name: hypercorrection
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a mistake in writing or speech caused by someone trying to show that they know how to use language correctly according to the rules when in fact the form that they are using is wrong : Hypercorrection is also responsible for things like the use of "whom" instead of "who" whenever someone wants to sound more fancy. I'm most pedantic about hypercorrections such as using "I" as an object in "you and I".
More examplesFewer examplesThis sort of phonetic hypercorrection is fairly common in language.Some mistakes come from hypercorrections.The use of "había cantado" can thus be considered as an instance of hypercorrection.
